reviews.review_msg: I found that Dr. Lajoie spoke too slowly, spent too much time on simple concepts, and read directly off the slides. I also found she was unable to answer questions and disregarded research from faculties other than BPK.
I thought she was a pretty good prof.  I ended up doing fairly well in the class.  Labs are very easy.

She's a fair marker.  I found her questions to be a little simpler than some of Marigold's hypothetical questions.  Marigold's a smoother speaker (Lajoie is from Quebec), but when she got settled in I found her letures easy to follow.  Plus, she's the best looking prof I've had so far.

Good speaker.  No textbook required, which is great.  Tells you a lot of what's going to be on the exam.  But you really need to prepare for hypothetical questions.  Don't go into the test just memorizing everything.  Go to his office hours, ask him if you're on the right track with things.

Now this guy can teach. Best KIN prof I've had so far. Tells you 'exactly' what's going to be on the test, so you don't waste time reading other useless info. PS. no textbook need only his lecture notes :)
Has an excellent knowledge of the course. Available for help, exams are fair. No need for a textbook. Tells tidbits of information that is funny. Overall I'd give him an A
Great Professor... gives lots of hints on what will be on the exams... no textbook a plus.
Funny lame jokes + fair tests + no textbook = great class.

Great Prof! Midterms are pure memorization. Really great guy too, the class struggled on the first midterm and he took a lecture to go over every question in detail. Overal, much better than the past profs who taught this course.

Leigh has an amazing talent of teaching and explained the course material! He truly loves the course and material which help makes it really fun and interesting to learn. I would take any class that he would teach.
